definitions.definition: A wooden cross used for crucifixions, as by the Romans.
An ornamental or symbolic sculptural representation of Christ on a cross, often worn as a pendant or displayed in a Christian church.
definitions.example: Plain crosses are preferred by Protestants, but crucifixes by Catholics.

definitions.definition: The iron cross, a position on the rings where the gymnast holds the rings straight out on either side of the body.
To set up or arrange something in advance so that it is ready for operation for a particular purpose, or to someone's particular liking.
To set up or configure a software system or hardware device with standard settings before selling or implementing it.
To release or loosen from something that binds, entangles, holds, or interlocks.
Unconnected; detached.
Not (socially) engaged; available, free.
To subject a substance to distillation.
To undergo or be produced by distillation.
To make by means of distillation, especially whisky.
To exude in small drops.
definitions.example: Firs distill resin.

definitions.definition: To impart in small quantities.
To extract the essence of; concentrate; purify.
To trickle down or fall in small drops; ooze out.
To be manifested gently or gradually.
To drip or be wet with.
Distillation
A dummy or other crude representation of a person, group or object that is hated.
A likeness of a person.
A Hebrew nikud vowel sign written as two vertical dots beneath a letter, indicating either the phoneme /ə/ or the complete absence of a vowel.
To surpass in skill or achievement.
To beat in a contest
A substance used as an indicator of a biological state, most commonly disease.
In a way that is not official.
A large room, especially one used to receive and entertain guests.
A gathering of people for a social or intellectual meeting.
An art gallery or exhibition; especially the Paris salon or autumn salon.
A beauty salon or similar establishment.
A tavern, especially in an American Old West setting.
A lounge bar in an English public house, contrasted with the public bar.
definitions.example: A pint of beer in the saloon bar costs a penny more than in the public bar.

definitions.definition: The most common body style for modern cars, with a boot or trunk.
The cabin area of a boat or yacht devoted to seated relaxation, often combined with dining table.
The part of a rail carriage or multiple unit containing seating for passengers.
To attack with harsh words or violent force (also figuratively).
definitions.example: Muggers assailed them as they entered an alley.

definitions.definition: To tremble, shake, or shiver with cold.
To be uncertain or unable to make a decision about doing something.
To do something nervously.
To render an approximation of (an image, etc.) by using dot patterns to approximate (the features of) colors not in the system palette.
To intentionally add noise to a signal to randomize errors.
The act of one who dithers.
To anger or infuriate.
definitions.example: I think it would incense him to learn the truth.

definitions.definition: To incite, stimulate.
To offer incense to.
To perfume with, or as with, incense.
To set on fire; to inflame; to kindle; to burn.
Enraged; infuriated; spitefully or furiously angry.
To make bald or shorter by using a tool such as a razor or pair of electric clippers to cut the hair close to the skin.
To cut anything in this fashion.
definitions.example: The labourer with the bending scythe is seen / Shaving the surface of the waving green.

definitions.definition: To remove hair from one's face by this means.
definitions.example: I had little time to shave this morning.

definitions.definition: To cut finely, as with slices of meat.
To skim along or near the surface of; to pass close to, or touch lightly, in passing.
To reduce in size or weight.
To be hard and severe in a bargain with; to practice extortion on; to cheat.
To buy (a note) at a discount greater than the legal rate of interest, or to deduct in discounting it more than the legal rate allows.
An instance of shaving.
definitions.example: I instructed the barber to give me a shave.

definitions.definition: A thin slice; a shaving.
An exorbitant discount on a note.
A premium paid for an extension of the time of delivery or payment, or for the right to vary a stock contract in any particular.
A hand tool consisting of a sharp blade with a handle at each end; a spokeshave.
A narrow miss or escape; a close shave.
The act of venerating or the state of being venerated.
Profound reverence, respect or awe.
Religious zeal, idolatry or devotion.
A series of chisel points mounted on one piece of steel. For example, the toothed stone chisel shown here.
A broad chisel for stone-cutting.
A spit for cooking food.
An awl; a bodkin; also, a wooden rod or pin, sharpened at each end, used by thatchers.
A spire rising from a tower.
A spit-like start on the head of a young stag.
The stick from which candle wicks are suspended for dipping.
The pin in a lock which enters the barrel of the key.
A piece of women’s ornamental jewellery having a pin allowing it to be fixed to garments worn on the upper body.
A painting all of one colour, such as a sepia painting.
To make a hole in, especially a cask of liquor, and put in a tap in order to draw the liquid.
To open, to make an opening into; to pierce.
definitions.example: French knights at Agincourt were unable to broach the English line.

definitions.definition: To begin discussion about (something).
definitions.example: I broached the subject of contraceptives carefully when the teenager mentioned his promiscuity.

definitions.definition: To be turned sideways to oncoming waves, especially large or breaking waves.
definitions.example: The small boat broached and nearly sank, because of the large waves.

definitions.definition: To cause to turn sideways to oncoming waves, especially large or breaking waves (usually followed by to; also figurative).
definitions.example: Each time we came around into the wind, the sea broached our bow.

definitions.definition: Great unhappiness; extreme pain of body or mind; wretchedness; distress; woe.
definitions.example: Ever since his wife left him you can see the misery on his face.

definitions.definition: A bodily ache or pain.
Cause of misery; calamity; misfortune.
(Extreme) poverty.
Greed; avarice.
Any salt of hypochlorous acid; used as a household bleach
A person, thing or name typifying a certain quality or idea; an embodiment or exemplification.
definitions.example: Adolf Hitler was the personification of anti-Semitism.

definitions.definition: A literary device in which an inanimate object or an idea is given human qualities.
definitions.example: The writer used personification to convey her ideas.

definitions.definition: An artistic representation of an abstract quality as a human
An SI subunit of length equal to 10-9 metres. Symbol: nm
A container like an open bucket (usually to hold and carry coal).
A broad, shallow basket.
A dish, platter or a trencher.
A small hatch or opening in a boat. Also, small opening in a boat or ship for draining water from open deck.
A hatch that provides access to the roof from the interior of a building.
A quick pace; a short run.
To cut a hole or holes through the bottom, deck, or sides of (as of a ship), for any purpose.
To deliberately sink one's ship or boat by any means, usually by order of the vessel's commander or owner.
(by extension, in figurative use) Undermine or thwart oneself (sometimes intentionally), or denigrate or destroy one's position or property; compare scupper.
definitions.example: The candidate had scuttled his chances with his unhinged outburst.

definitions.definition: To move hastily, to scurry.
Of or pertaining to the ilium.
To give off sparks; to shine as if emanating sparks; to twinkle or glow.
To throw off like sparks.
That scintillates with brief flashes of light; sparkling.
Brilliantly or impressively clever, exciting, amusing or witty.
A magnetic mineral, Fe3O4, one of the primary ores of iron. It has also been called lodestone.
(Classical philosophy) Virtue, excellence.
(Classical philosophy) The proper state or condition for a human.
A very thin ridge of rock.
Not smooth; uneven.
Approximate; hasty or careless; not finished.
definitions.example: a rough estimate; a rough sketch of a building; a rough plan

definitions.definition: Turbulent.
definitions.example: rough sea

definitions.definition: Difficult; trying.
definitions.example: Being a teenager nowadays can be rough.

definitions.definition: Crude; unrefined
definitions.example: His manners are a bit rough, but he means well.

definitions.definition: Violent; not careful or subtle
definitions.example: This box has been through some rough handling.

definitions.definition: Loud and hoarse; offensive to the ear; harsh; grating.
definitions.example: a rough tone; a rough voice

definitions.definition: Not polished; uncut; said of a gem.
definitions.example: a rough diamond

definitions.definition: Harsh-tasting.
definitions.example: rough wine

definitions.definition: Somewhat ill; sick
Unwell due to alcohol; hungover
A worker who shapes something to prepare it for a finishing operation.
A piece of woollen cloth prepared for fulling.
To assign an additional name to an entity, often a more user-friendly one.
(of two signals) to become indistinguishable
Using more than one name, or being referred to in more than one way.
An implement for opening bottles that are sealed by a cork. Sometimes specifically such an implement that includes a screw-shaped part, or worm.
definitions.example: I opened the wine with a corkscrew.

definitions.definition: The screw-shaped worm of a typical corkscrew.
A type of sharp, twisting punch, often one thrown close and from the side.
(amusement rides) A type of inversion used in roller coasters.
To wind or twist in the manner of a corkscrew; to move with much horizontal and vertical shifting.
To cause something to twist or move in a spiral path or shape.
To extract information or consent from someone.
To take the place of; to replace, to supersede.
definitions.example: Will online dictionaries ever supplant paper dictionaries?

definitions.definition: To uproot, to remove violently.
Technical
definitions.example: Are there any techy types around? My computer has stopped working.

definitions.definition: Easily annoyed or irritated; peevish, testy or irascible.
A type of rotating file index used for storing addresses, especially in a work context.
(by extension) One's contact list.
Scornfully mocking or cynical.
definitions.example: He distances himself from people with his nasty, sardonic laughter.

definitions.definition: Disdainfully or ironically humorous.
Terrified; struck with amazement; showing signs of terror or horror.
definitions.example: I was aghast when the incident unfolded in front of me.

definitions.definition: A room in a home or hotel set aside for the use of visiting guests.
A market for the trading of company stock.
A cattle market.
A possible event; something that may happen.
An individual's propensity to take notice of events, changes, or facts.
Used to express pleasure, joy, or great excitement.
definitions.example: Our second goal of the match! Yes!

definitions.definition: Response that confirms that the user is paying attention.
You (plural).
You (singular).
Clothing, garments, dress, material.
Having spikes, spiny.
Hostile; standoffish
definitions.example: a spiky personality

definitions.definition: Of hair, erect, resembling spikes.
To cease the use of.
To disaccustom.
definitions.example: He was disused to hard work.

definitions.definition: No longer in use.
To remove foreign and harmful substances from something.
To bend the upper part of the body forward and downward to a half-squatting position; crouch.
definitions.example: He stooped to tie his shoe-laces.

definitions.definition: To lower oneself; to demean or do something below one's status, standards, or morals.
definitions.example: Can you believe that a salesman would stoop so low as to hide his customers' car keys until they agreed to the purchase?

definitions.definition: Of a bird of prey: to swoop down on its prey.
To cause to incline downward; to slant.
definitions.example: to stoop a cask of liquor

definitions.definition: To cause to submit; to prostrate.
To yield; to submit; to bend, as by compulsion; to assume a position of humility or subjection.
To descend from rank or dignity; to condescend.
To degrade.
In a bent bodily position, hunched
(derogatory stereotype) An unsophisticated person from a working class background.
An Anglo-Celtic member of a lower socioeconomic group, stereotypically classified as wearing black jumpers or black concert T-shirts.
A petrolhead.
Any narrow water or creek, particularly a tranquil backwater.
(North Western Ontario) An indigenous person.
To act like a bogan.
Any of various shrubs or small trees of the genus Rhus and other genera in Anacardiaceae, particularly the elm-leaved sumac, Sicilian sumac, or tanner's sumac (Rhus coriaria).
Dried and chopped-up leaves and stems of a plant of the genus Rhus, particularly the tanner's sumac (see sense 1), used for dyeing and tanning leather or for medicinal purposes.
A sour spice popular in the Eastern Mediterranean, made from the berries of tanner's sumac.
To apply a preparation of sumac to (an object), for example, to a piece of leather to tan it.

A sterol lipid synthesized by the liver and transported in the bloodstream to the membranes of all animal cells; it plays a central role in many biochemical processes and, as a lipoprotein that coats the walls of blood vessels, is associated with cardiovascular disease.
The level of cholesterol in the body.
definitions.example: improve your cholesterol; lower your cholesterol

definitions.definition: The part of or interest in a deceased husband's property provided to his widow, usually in the form of a life estate.
Property given by a groom directly to his bride at or before their wedding in order to legitimize the marriage; dowry.
That with which one is gifted or endowed; endowment; gift.
To give a dower or dowry.
To endow.
An extremely toxic protein extracted from the castor bean.
A failure to function in an expected or complete manner. Usually refers to a disorder in a bodily organ (e.g. erectile dysfunction), a mental disorder, or the improper behavior of a social group.
Using an excessive number of words.
definitions.example: The story was long and very wordy.

definitions.definition: A person or device that determines a schedule, that determines the order that tasks are to be done.
An operating system component responsible for allocating several resources, most commonly the use of processors by different concurrent processes or threads.
An afterburner.
To heat something after it has cooled off, especially previously cooked food (also in figurative senses).
definitions.example: I’m reheating some leftovers for dinner.

definitions.definition: To become hot again after having cooled off (also in figurative senses).
definitions.example: He put the soup on the stove to reheat.

definitions.definition: Alternative form of rehete
A kind of cannabis smoked in Morocco and Algeria, for narcotic or intoxicating effect.
The state of relaxed stupor induced by cannabis.
The trichome of marijuana, a green powdery substance that falls from dry marijuana high in THC and other cannabinoid compounds.

A social system based on personal ownership of resources and personal fealty between a suzerain (lord) and a vassal (subject). Defining characteristics are direct ownership of resources, personal loyalty, and a hierarchical social structure reinforced by religion.
To telecommute.
The process of shedding or losing a covering of fur, feathers or skin etc.
definitions.example: Some birds change colour during their winter moult.

definitions.definition: The skin or feathers cast off during the process of moulting.
To shed or lose a covering of hair or fur, feathers, skin, horns, etc, and replace it with a fresh one.
To shed in such a manner.
To change (or to be changed) from a solid state to a liquid state, usually by a gradual heat.
definitions.example: I melted butter to make a cake.

definitions.definition: To dissolve, disperse, vanish.
definitions.example: His troubles melted away.

definitions.definition: To soften, as by a warming or kindly influence; to relax; to render gentle or susceptible to mild influences; sometimes, in a bad sense, to take away the firmness of; to weaken.
To be discouraged.
To be emotionally softened or touched.
definitions.example: She melted when she saw the romantic message in the Valentine's Day card.

definitions.definition: To be very hot and sweat profusely.
definitions.example: I need shade! I'm melting!

definitions.definition: The fibre obtained from the husk of a coconut, used chiefly in making rope, matting and as a peat substitute.
A lowercase letter.
Either of the two medieval handwriting styles minuscule cursive and Caroline minuscule.
A letter in these styles.
Written in minuscules, lowercase.
Written in minuscule handwriting style.
Very small, tiny.
definitions.example: a minuscule dot

definitions.definition: Arising from or occurring in more than one focus or location.
(of an eyeglass lens) having several focusing areas that correct for both nearsightedness and farsightedness.
A guard dog

An individual or group that monitors the activities of another entity (such as an individual, corporation, non-profit group, or governmental organization) on behalf of the public to ensure that entity does not behave illegally or unethically.
To perform a function analogous to that of a watchdog; to guard and warn.
To be continuously reset by a watchdog timer.
Master; sir: a title used in the Middle Ages, given to a person in authority, or to one having a license from a university to teach philosophy and the liberal arts.
The possessor of a master's degree.
An organism that is too small to be seen by the unaided eye, especially a single-celled organism, such as a bacterium.
definitions.example: The cud is then reswallowed and further digested by specialized microorganisms that live in the rumen.

definitions.definition: To make (a piece of) needlework using a hooked needle; to make interlocking loops of thread.
To play music in measured time
A musical note one beat long in 4/4 time.
A sharp curve or crook; a shape resembling a hook
A whim or a fancy
A forked support; a crotch.
An indentation in the glacis of the covered way, at a point where a traverse is placed.
The arrangement of a body of troops, either forward or rearward, so as to form a line nearly perpendicular to the general line of battle.
A square bracket.
To connect or assemble pieces using a bolt.
definitions.example: Bolt the vice to the bench.

definitions.definition: To secure a door by locking or barring it.
definitions.example: Bolt the door.

definitions.definition: To flee, to depart, to accelerate suddenly.
definitions.example: Seeing the snake, the horse bolted.

definitions.definition: To cause to start or spring forth; to dislodge (an animal being hunted).
definitions.example: to bolt a rabbit

definitions.definition: To strike or fall suddenly like a bolt.
To escape.
Of a plant, to grow quickly; to go to seed.
definitions.example: Lettuce and spinach will bolt as the weather warms up.

definitions.definition: To swallow food without chewing it.
To drink one's drink very quickly; to down a drink.
definitions.example: Come on, everyone, bolt your drinks; I want to go to the next pub!

definitions.definition: To refuse to support a nomination made by a party or caucus with which one has been connected; to break away from a party.
To utter precipitately; to blurt or throw out.
To sift, especially through a cloth.
To sift the bran and germ from wheat flour.
definitions.example: Graham flour is unbolted flour.

definitions.definition: To separate, assort, refine, or purify by other means.
To discuss or argue privately, and for practice, as cases at law.
A sifting, as of flour or meal.
A private arguing of cases for practice by students, as in the Inns of Court.
The act of one who lumbers; heavy, clumsy movement.
The business of felling trees for lumber.
Clumsy or awkward.
Heavy, slow and laborious; ponderous.
To make something fixed and stable; to fix.
To stare fixedly at something.
To attend to something to the exclusion of all others; used with on.
To attach oneself to a person or thing in a pathological or neurotic manner; used with on.
Attached to someone or something in a neurotic or pathological manner

A heavy mass of often iron or concrete, mechanically linked in opposition to a load which is to be raised and lowered, with the intent of reducing the amount of work which must be done to effect the raising and lowering. Counterweights are used, for example, in cable-hauled elevators and some kinds of movable bridges (e.g. a bascule bridge).
To fit with a counterweight.
An algebraic variety of degree 4.
To increase to four times as much; to multiply by four
Four times as great; quadruple.
Comprised of four individual members.
By a factor of four
To support by means of mechanical brackets.
To enclose in typographical brackets.
To bound on both sides, to surround, as enclosing with brackets.
definitions.example: I tried to hit the bullseye by first bracketing it with two shots and then splitting the difference with my third, but I missed.

definitions.definition: To place in the same category.
definitions.example: Because the didn't have enough young boys for two full teams, they bracketed the seven-year olds with the eight-year olds.

definitions.definition: To mark distinctly for special treatment.
To set aside, discount, ignore.
To take multiple images of the same subject, using a range of exposure settings, in order to help ensure that a satisfactory image is obtained.

(phenomenology) In the philosophical system of Edmund Husserl and his followers, to set aside metaphysical theories and existential questions concerning what is real in order to focus philosophical attention simply on the actual content of experience.
A series or group of brackets; brackets, collectively.
The act of enclosing (text, etc.) in brackets.
A strong unpleasant smell.
Vapour; steam; smoke; fume.
A hill; a mountain.
To have or give off a strong, unpleasant smell.
definitions.example: You reek of perfume.

definitions.definition: To be evidently associated with something unpleasant.
definitions.example: The boss appointing his nephew as a director reeks of nepotism.

definitions.definition: To be emitted or exhaled, emanate, as of vapour or perfume.
To emit smoke or vapour; to steam.
Pertaining to the planet Jupiter.
Pertaining to the Roman god Jove or Jupiter (the counterpart of the Greek god Zeus); Jove-like; befitting Jupiter.
To pardon; to waive any negative feeling or desire for punishment, retribution, or compensation.
definitions.example: Forgive others, not because they deserve forgiveness, but because you deserve peace.

definitions.definition: To accord forgiveness.
To undo the integrity of, break into parts.
To fall apart, break up into parts.
Any plant of the genus Euphorbia, the spurges.
A political doctrine or philosophy that proposes that the rights and powers of ordinary people are exploited by a privileged elite, and supports their struggle to overcome this.
The practice of appealing to the interests of the common people.
The part of something that has spoiled.
The process of spoiling.
definitions.example: To prevent spoilage, store in a cool, dry place.

definitions.definition: To cool down, make cool.
Now specifically, to keep cool by containing within a refrigerator.
definitions.example: Please refrigerate your uncooked meats at or below 40° Fahrenheit.

definitions.definition: The act or an instance of receding or withdrawing.
A period of reduced economic activity
The ceremonial filing out of clergy and/or choir at the end of a church service.
The act of ceding something back.
Fish, shellfish, seaweed, and other edible aquatic life.
Biological products, such as antitoxins or vaccines, used to induce immunity
Biological weapons
To refill; to renew; to supply again or to add a fresh quantity to.
definitions.example: It's a popular product, and they have to replenish their stock of it frequently.

definitions.definition: To fill up; to complete; to supply fully.
To finish; to complete; to perfect.

A small bus, especially one used as transport for small groups.
A-sixteen seater vehicle used as a taxi. A kombi.
A small four-wheeled carriage.
(US politics) A combined spending bill for multiple departments that is smaller than an omnibus bill.
The point of junction between two things, in particular a support, that abuts.
The solid portion of a structure that supports the lateral pressure of an arch or vault.
A construction that supports the ends of a bridge; a structure that anchors the cables on a suspension bridge.
The part of a valley or canyon wall against which a dam is constructed.

definitions.definition: Something that abuts, or on which something abuts.
The state of abutting.
That element that shares a common boundary or surface with its neighbor.
The tooth that supports a denture or bridge.
A fixed point or surface where resistance is obtained.
That is beyond memory; ancient.

definitions.definition: (positive) Ancient beyond memory.
definitions.example: The immemorial existence of a port on the spot would shew such a possible good legal origin as would support the immemorial custom.

definitions.definition: Exhibiting or possessing prescience: having knowledge of, or seemingly able to correctly predict, events before they take place.
To cause a quality to become part of someone's nature.
definitions.example: It is important to instill discipline in a child at an early age.

definitions.definition: To pour in (medicine, for example) drop by drop.
The process by which something is instilled.
One who robs others in a lawless area, especially as part of a group.
An outlaw.

An obnoxious, selfish and overbearing person; an attention hog.

A ghost, goblin, or other hostile supernatural creature.
A bugbear: any terrifying thing.

A score of one over par on a hole.

To immerse oneself in, to occupy oneself with, metaphorically.

To wither; to fade.
Tasteless, flat.

definitions.definition: A spectacle; a noisy fuss; a chaotic and/or crowded place.
In the ancient Roman Empire, a building for chariot racing.

(World War II) A code name for bomber attacks with fighter escorts in the day time. The attacks were against short-range targets with the intention of occupying enemy fighters and keeping their fighter units in the area concerned.
Circuit; space; enclosure.
A nucleoside derived from guanine and ribose
A line joining non-adjacent vertices of a polygon.
Anything forming or resembling such a line, particularly:
In a grammatical manner
Concerning grammar
To give something a definite form; to shape.
To give something a formal or official standing.
To act with formality.
A note or notation made in a side margin.
A minor related mention, made as an aside, or afterthought.
definitions.example: As a side note, I'd like to thank that team for their hard work.

definitions.definition: Resembling or relating to the epic poetry of Homer.
Of or pertaining to Greece during the Bronze Age, as described in Homer's works.
Fit to be immortalized in poetry by Homer; epic, heroic.
A hand tool for adjusting nuts and bolts; a wrench.
definitions.example: Pass me that spanner, Jake; there's just one more nut to screw in.

definitions.definition: One who, or that which, spans.
A hand tool shaped like a small crank handle, for winding the spring of a wheel lock on a musket.
A device in early steam engines for moving the valves for the alternate admission and shutting off of the steam.
A problem, dilemma or obstacle; something unexpected or troublesome (in the phrase spanner in the works)
(mildly) A stupid or unintelligent person; one prone to making mistakes, especially in language.
Below the level of conscious awareness.
The study of photochemical reactions.
A diacritical mark (ˆ) placed over a vowel in the orthography or transliteration of many languages to change its pronunciation; while in some other languages over a consonant.
To mark or pronounce with a circumflex.
definitions.example: to circumflex a syllable

definitions.definition: Having a circumflex mark.
definitions.example: ê is e circumflex.

definitions.definition: Curving around.
definitions.example: The circumflex coronary artery

definitions.definition: An airplane that has two main wings, one above the other and supported by struts
Having, or consisting of, two superposed planes, aerocurves, etc.
definitions.example: a biplane rudder

definitions.definition: The state of being specific rather than general.
The extent to which a characteristic is specific to a given person, place, or thing; thus:
Born free rather than in bondage or as a slave
A man or boy with brown or black hair.
Of a man's or boy's hair: brown or black.
Of a man or boy, having brown or black hair.
To subdue someone by superior force.
definitions.example: We overpowered the opposing army within a couple of hours.

definitions.definition: To excel or exceed in power; to cause to yield; to subdue.
definitions.example: Bright light overpowers the eyes.

definitions.definition: To render imperceptible by means of greater strength, intensity etc.
definitions.example: The dish was OK, but the garlic slightly overpowered the herbs.

definitions.definition: To make excessively powerful.
An area of low fertility and habitation, a desolate place.
definitions.example: The pine barrens are a site lonely enough to suit any hermit.

definitions.definition: A one-stringed instrument (monochord) that consists of a wire string attached to something solid like the side of a house, and played with a piece of metal or glass, originating in the African American traditional music of Mississippi in the United States.
A nervous or jittery person.
A jazz musician or aficionado.
An uptempo jazz or swing dance which embellishes on the two-step pattern and frequently incorporates acrobatic style swing steps.
To dance the jitterbug.

An antihistamine and anticholinergic drug that blocks the effect of histamine at H1 receptor sites, relieving allergy symptoms. Diphenhydramine also reduces smooth muscle contraction, increases heart rate, and sedates the user by blocking muscarinic acetylcholine receptors (mAChRs).
An employee (such as a secretary) who works in reception (receiving visitors and/or calls) for a person or business, especially an office.
A proponent of receptionism.
To set out the meaning of; to explain or discuss at length
To make a statement, especially at length.
definitions.example: He expounded often on the dangers of the imperial presidency.

definitions.definition: Of, befitting, pertaining to, or characteristic of a wife.
A married woman, especially in relation to her spouse.
The female of a pair of mated animals.
definitions.example: A new wife for the gander is introduced into the pen.

definitions.definition: An adult female human.
(collective) All females collectively; womankind.
A female person, usually an adult; a (generally adult) female sentient being, whether human, supernatural, elf, alien, etc.
A wife (or sometimes a fiancée or girlfriend).
A female who is extremely fond of or devoted to a specified type of thing. (Used as the last element of a compound.)
A female attendant or servant.
A heavy rain.
definitions.example: They got caught in a downpour without an umbrella and came back soaked.

definitions.definition: To pour down; rain heavily.
The act of domesticating, or accustoming to home; the action of taming wild animals or breeding plants.
The act of domesticating, or making a legal instrument recognized and enforceable in a jurisdiction foreign to the one in which the instrument was originally issued or created.
The act of domesticating a text.
(grammar) A function word.
A function object.

A category homomorphism; a morphism from a source category to a target category which maps objects to objects and arrows to arrows, in such a way as to preserve domains and codomains (of the arrows) as well as composition and identities.
definitions.example: In the category of categories, \mathbb{CAT}, the objects are categories and the morphisms are functors.

definitions.definition: To contract out portions of a larger contracted project.
A message delivered along with a kiss, usually arranged as a surprise on a special occasion.
To confuse and bewilder; to leave speechless.
Shocked and speechless.
Various former units of length notionally based on the distance from a grown man's elbow to his fingertips, standardized in different places and times at values between 35 and 60 cm.
The ulna.
Wrongful; harmful.
Of, pertaining to, or characteristic of torts.
To live, last or remain longer than.
definitions.example: Some think that classical music would outlast pop.

definitions.definition: (chiefly in the plural) A serving of beer.
Foamy or churned to the point of becoming infused with bubbles.
definitions.example: I like my milkshakes frothy, not flat like this!

definitions.definition: Lightweight; lacking depth or substance
definitions.example: a frothy argument

definitions.definition: In every direction, especially of a radio system capable of transmitting or receiving signals in all directions, or of a microphone capable of detecting sound from all directions.
Having a ring-shaped radiation pattern, with equal radiation in all azimuthal directions.
The worldwide Muslim community.
An eccentric, strange or crazy person.
(kiteboarding, wakeboarding) A boardsport participant who lacks style or skill; a newbie who acts as if they are better at the sport than they are.
Any of a group of inherited disorders in which the amount of hemoglobin in the blood is reduced.
To drive or campaign ardently for, as an effort, project, etc.
definitions.example: He spearheaded the entire project from day one.

definitions.definition: An anchorman in a news program, a news anchor, newscaster.
A program for reading and posting to newsgroups.
Someone living in the same house.
Urban fashion; clothing that can be worn on the street
(of a person) calm, relaxed, casual and informal
(of a journey or pace) unhurried
To make resistant to transmitting sound.
definitions.example: We soundproofed the room so we couldn't hear the road noises; unfortunately we couldn't hear the fire alarm either.

definitions.definition: Not allowing sound through.
definitions.example: The contestant was placed in a soundproof booth so he could not receive help from the audience.

definitions.definition: To toil, to work.
To belabour, to emphasise or expand upon (a point in a debate, etc).
definitions.example: I think we've all got the idea. There's no need to labour the point.

definitions.definition: To be oppressed with difficulties or disease; to do one's work under conditions which make it especially hard or wearisome; to move slowly, as against opposition, or under a burden.
To suffer the pangs of childbirth.
To pitch or roll heavily, as a ship in a turbulent sea.
The act of one who labours; toil; work done.
Any lizard of the family Gekkonidae. They are small, carnivorous, mostly nocturnal animals with large eyes and adhesive toes enabling them to climb on vertical and upside-down surfaces.
To move in the manner of a gecko; to attach to a vertical or upside-down surface.
A portion of a total amount of a solution or suspension.
Not bleached.
To splash; to scatter; to land or strike in an uneven, distributed mess.
definitions.example: The drink splattered all over me, the table, and the floor when I knocked it over.

definitions.definition: To cause (something) to splatter.
definitions.example: He splattered paint onto the wall.

definitions.definition: To spatter (something or somebody).
To be a father to; to sire.
To give rise to.
To act as a father; to support and nurture.
To provide with a father.
To adopt as one's own.
Something trifling, or of no consequence or importance.
A trivial remark (especially in the term sweet nothings).
A nobody (insignificant person).
definitions.example: You're nothing to me now!

definitions.definition: In an uneven or haphazard manner.
In an unequal manner.
An agent of one intelligence agency or group who pretends to be interested in defecting or turning to another intelligence agency or group.
The action of dangling; a series of complex stick tricks and fakes in order to defeat the defender in style.
definitions.example: That was a sick dangle for a great goal!

definitions.definition: A dangling ornament or decoration.
To hang loosely with the ability to swing.
definitions.example: His feet would dangle in the water.

definitions.definition: The action of performing a move or deke with the puck in order to get past a defender or goalie; perhaps because of the resemblance to dangling the puck on a string.
definitions.example: He dangled around three players and the goalie to score.

definitions.definition: To hang or trail something loosely.
definitions.example: I like to sit on the edge and dangle my feet in the water.

definitions.definition: To trail or follow around.
Of a patient: to be positioned with the legs hanging over the edge of the bed.
To position (a patient) in this way.
The quality of being helical.
Any of certain measures of the extent to which vortex lines (in fluid flow) or field lines (in a magnetic or electromagnetic field) kink and twist and/or link and coil around one another.
The quantized spin component of a moving particle along the direction of its motion.
(leet) Used to express laughter, often in a sarcastic fashion.
definitions.example: 1999:"you mean "C"hina??? lolz!!!" — http//groups-beta.google.com/group/talk.politics.tibet/msg/74bdbd4eb17f4b22
